greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of exponents >= 2 in canonical prime factorization of A025487(n) (first integer of each prime signature).
comment: Length of row n of A212175 equals a(n) if a(n) is positive, 1 otherwise.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to prime signature
example: The canonical prime factorization of 24 (2^3*3) has 1 exponent that equals or exceeds 2. Since 24 = A025487(8), a(8) = 1.
results.author: _Matthew Vandermast_, Jun 04 2012
